name: OciComputeInstance
description:
OciComputeInstance is the top-level resource representing an Oracle Cloud
 Infrastructure compute instance (virtual machine or bare metal host).

fields.name: CompartmentId
fields.description: OCID of the compartment where the instance will be created.

fields.name: AvailabilityDomain
fields.description:
Availability domain where the instance will be placed
 (e.g. "Ixxj:US-ASHBURN-AD-1"). Changing this forces recreation.

fields.name: Shape
fields.description:
Compute shape that determines the base hardware profile
 (e.g. "VM.Standard.E4.Flex", "VM.Standard.A1.Flex", "BM.Standard3.64").
 Flex shapes require shape_config to specify OCPUs and memory.

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description:
Human-readable name shown in the OCI Console.
 Falls back to metadata.name if not provided.

fields.name: ShapeConfig
fields.description:
Shape configuration for flexible shapes. Required when the chosen shape
 name contains "Flex". Ignored for fixed shapes.

fields.name: SourceDetails
fields.description: Boot source for the instance: either an image OCID or a boot volume OCID.

fields.name: CreateVnicDetails
fields.description: Primary VNIC configuration that determines the instance's network placement.

fields.name: Metadata
fields.description:
Instance metadata key-value pairs. Common keys:
   - "ssh_authorized_keys": newline-separated public SSH keys
   - "user_data": base64-encoded cloud-init script

fields.name: FaultDomain
fields.description:
Fault domain within the availability domain (e.g. "FAULT-DOMAIN-1").
 OCI distributes instances across fault domains for HA when unspecified.

fields.name: IsPvEncryptionInTransitEnabled
fields.description:
When true, enables in-transit encryption for the paravirtualized boot
 and data volume attachments. Changing this forces recreation.

fields.name: AgentConfig
fields.description:
Oracle Cloud Agent configuration controlling monitoring, management,
 and plugin behavior on the instance.

fields.name: AvailabilityConfig
fields.description: Availability and recovery behavior for infrastructure maintenance events.

fields.name: LaunchOptions
fields.description:
Low-level launch options for boot volume type, network type, and firmware.
 Most users can omit this; the defaults chosen by OCI based on the image
 and shape are appropriate for the vast majority of workloads.

fields.name: InstanceOptions
fields.description: Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) endpoint configuration.

fields.name: PreemptibleInstanceConfig
fields.description:
Configures the instance as preemptible (spot-like), allowing OCI to
 reclaim it when capacity is needed. Significantly reduces cost for
 fault-tolerant workloads.

fields.name: CapacityReservationId
fields.description: OCID of a capacity reservation to launch this instance against.

fields.name: DedicatedVmHostId
fields.description:
OCID of a dedicated VM host to place this instance on.
 Used for workloads requiring physical isolation for compliance or licensing.

fields.name: PlatformConfig
fields.description:
Platform-level security and hardware configuration. The applicable fields
 depend on the platform type: VM shapes (amd_vm, intel_vm) support secure
 boot, measured boot, TPM, and memory encryption; bare metal shapes support
 additional hardware tuning (NUMA, core percentage, SMT, etc.).

nestedTypes.name: AgentConfig
nestedTypes.description:
AgentConfig controls the Oracle Cloud Agent software that runs inside the
 instance for monitoring, management, and OS patching.

fields.name: AreAllPluginsDisabled
fields.description: When true, disables all Oracle Cloud Agent plugins.

fields.name: IsManagementDisabled
fields.description: When true, disables the management agent (OS Management, etc.).

fields.name: IsMonitoringDisabled
fields.description: When true, disables the monitoring agent (Compute Instance Monitoring).

fields.name: PluginsConfig
fields.description: Per-plugin overrides.

nestedTypes.name: AvailabilityConfig
nestedTypes.description:
AvailabilityConfig controls how the instance behaves during infrastructure
 maintenance events.

fields.name: IsLiveMigrationPreferred
fields.description: When true, OCI prefers live migration over reboot during maintenance.

fields.name: RecoveryAction
fields.description: Action to take when the underlying host has an unplanned failure.

nestedTypes.name: CreateVnicDetails
nestedTypes.description:
CreateVnicDetails configures the primary virtual network interface card
 (VNIC) attached to the instance. This determines the subnet, security
 groups, IP addressing, and DNS registration.

fields.name: SubnetId
fields.description: OCID of the subnet for the primary VNIC.

fields.name: NsgIds
fields.description: OCIDs of network security groups to associate with the VNIC.

fields.name: AssignPublicIp
fields.description:
Whether to assign a public IP. When unset, uses the subnet default
 (public subnets assign; private subnets do not).

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: Display name for the VNIC in the OCI Console.

fields.name: HostnameLabel
fields.description:
Hostname label for DNS within the subnet's DNS domain.
 Must be alphanumeric, start with a letter, max 63 chars.

fields.name: PrivateIp
fields.description:
Specific private IP address to assign. Must be available within the
 subnet's CIDR. When omitted, OCI auto-assigns.

fields.name: SkipSourceDestCheck
fields.description:
When true, disables source/destination checking on the VNIC.
 Required for NAT instances or virtual routers.

fields.name: AssignPrivateDnsRecord
fields.description: Whether to register a private DNS record for the VNIC.

nestedTypes.name: InstanceOptions
nestedTypes.description:
InstanceOptions controls the Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) endpoint
 behavior.

fields.name: AreLegacyImdsEndpointsDisabled
fields.description:
When true, disables the legacy IMDSv1 endpoints. Recommended for
 security: use only the IMDSv2 token-based endpoint.

nestedTypes.name: LaunchOptions
nestedTypes.description:
LaunchOptions configure low-level boot and network settings. These are
 usually set automatically based on the image and shape; only override
 when you have specific requirements (e.g., paravirtualized networking
 for higher throughput).

 boot_volume_type and network_type use strings instead of enums because
 both sets share values ("VFIO", "PARAVIRTUALIZED") and protobuf's C++
 scoping rules prevent duplicate enum values in the same enclosing message.

fields.name: BootVolumeType
fields.description:
Emulation type for the boot volume attachment.
 Valid values: "ISCSI", "SCSI", "IDE", "VFIO", "PARAVIRTUALIZED".

fields.name: NetworkType
fields.description:
Emulation type for the primary network interface.
 Valid values: "E1000", "VFIO", "PARAVIRTUALIZED".

fields.name: Firmware
fields.description: Firmware type for the instance.

fields.name: IsPvEncryptionInTransitEnabled
fields.description: In-transit encryption for the boot volume attachment (within launch options).

fields.name: IsConsistentVolumeNamingEnabled
fields.description: Consistent naming for attached volumes (e.g. /dev/oracleoci/...).

nestedTypes.name: PlatformConfig
nestedTypes.description:
PlatformConfig provides hardware-level security and performance settings.
 The available settings vary by shape family:
   - VM shapes (amd_vm, intel_vm): secure boot, measured boot, TPM, memory encryption
   - Bare metal shapes: all VM options plus NUMA, core percentage, SMT, etc.
 Fields that don't apply to the chosen type are ignored by the OCI API.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Platform type. Must match the instance shape family.

fields.name: IsSecureBootEnabled
fields.description: Enable Secure Boot to verify boot software signatures (VM + BM).

fields.name: IsMeasuredBootEnabled
fields.description: Enable Measured Boot for integrity measurements stored in the TPM (VM + BM).

fields.name: IsTrustedPlatformModuleEnabled
fields.description: Enable the Trusted Platform Module for secure key storage (VM + BM).

fields.name: IsMemoryEncryptionEnabled
fields.description: Enable AMD SEV or Intel TME memory encryption (VM + BM).

fields.name: IsSymmetricMultiThreadingEnabled
fields.description: Enable Symmetric Multi-Threading (SMT/Hyperthreading). BM shapes only.

fields.name: AreVirtualInstructionsEnabled
fields.description: Enable nested virtualization (AMD-V or VT-x). BM shapes only.

fields.name: IsAccessControlServiceEnabled
fields.description: Enable Access Control Service for PCI passthrough isolation. BM shapes only.

fields.name: IsInputOutputMemoryManagementUnitEnabled
fields.description: Enable IOMMU for device memory protection. BM shapes only.

fields.name: NumaNodesPerSocket
fields.description:
NUMA nodes per socket configuration. BM shapes only.
 Valid values: "NPS0", "NPS1", "NPS2", "NPS4".

fields.name: PercentageOfCoresEnabled
fields.description: Percentage of cores enabled on the instance. BM shapes only.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Plugin name (e.g. "Vulnerability Scanning", "OS Management Service Agent").

fields.name: DesiredState
fields.description: Whether the plugin should be enabled or disabled.

nestedTypes.name: PreemptibleInstanceConfig
nestedTypes.description:
PreemptibleInstanceConfig configures the instance as preemptible.
 Preemptible instances can be reclaimed by OCI at any time when capacity
 is needed, in exchange for significantly lower pricing.

fields.name: PreserveBootVolume
fields.description:
When true, the boot volume is preserved when the instance is preempted.
 When false, both instance and boot volume are terminated.

nestedTypes.name: ShapeConfig
nestedTypes.description: ShapeConfig specifies the exact resource allocation for flexible shapes.

fields.name: Ocpus
fields.description:
Number of OCPUs (Oracle CPUs). Each OCPU maps to a physical core
 with simultaneous multi-threading.

fields.name: MemoryInGbs
fields.description:
Amount of memory in GiB. Flex shapes allow a range per OCPU; consult
 the shape documentation for valid ratios.

fields.name: BaselineOcpuUtilization
fields.description:
Baseline OCPU utilization for burstable instances.
 Valid values: "BASELINE_1_8", "BASELINE_1_2", "BASELINE_1_1".
 Only applicable to burstable shapes.

fields.name: Nvmes
fields.description: Number of NVMe drives for dense-IO shapes.

nestedTypes.name: SourceDetails
nestedTypes.description:
SourceDetails defines the boot source -- either a platform/custom image
 or an existing boot volume to clone.

fields.name: SourceType
fields.description: Whether the instance boots from an image or an existing boot volume.

fields.name: SourceId
fields.description: OCID of the image or boot volume to launch from.

fields.name: BootVolumeSizeInGbs
fields.description:
Size of the boot volume in GiB. When launching from an image, defaults
 to the image's minimum size. Must be >= the image minimum.

fields.name: BootVolumeVpusPerGb
fields.description:
VPUs per GB for the boot volume (10=Balanced, 20=Higher Performance,
 30-120=Ultra High Performance). Defaults to 10.

fields.name: KmsKeyId
fields.description:
OCID of a KMS key to encrypt the boot volume at rest.
 default_kind will be added when OciKmsKey (R25) is implemented.
